intro: Sloanea sterculiacea var. assamica, commonly known as the Assam sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at moderate elevations. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of tropical flora.
